steps.title: Clean your skin gently before you apply your salicylic acid.
steps.content: Clean your skin gently before you apply your salicylic acid. This removes the oils from your skin before you apply your cream, gel, or pad. Use a gentle cleanser that doesn’t irritate your skin. Dry your skin with a clean towel before you apply the salicylic acid. Pat your skin when you dry it, rather than rubbing it, so you don't stress it before application.

steps.title: Apply a thin layer if using a cream or a lotion.
steps.content: Apply a thin layer if using a cream or a lotion. Use a cream or lotion with 3-6% salicylic acid. [1] X Research source Rub the product in gently until your skin absorbs it. [2] X Research source Don't worry if you see a thin film on top of your skin. Do this as often as you are instructed on the product or by your doctor. Most people do it first thing in the morning or right before bed at night.

steps.title: Place wet packs on your skin if you are using a gel.
steps.content: Place wet packs on your skin if you are using a gel. After 5 minutes, remove them. Apply enough gel to cover the area and rub it in. Use a gel with .5-5% salicylic acid. [3] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source There may be a thin, invisible film that remains on top of your skin. Leave this and it will eventually soak in too.

steps.title: Wipe your pad over the affected areas.
steps.content: Wipe your pad over the affected areas. The pad will contain the proper salicylic acid dosage for you. Make sure that you cover the entire area. Don’t wipe the medication off after use. Instead, let it dry on your skin. Don't wash the area or get it wet until the medication is dry.

steps.title: Clean your skin before you use your salicylic acid plaster.
steps.content: Clean your skin before you use your salicylic acid plaster. Use a gentle soap or cleanser to remove any excess oils. Make sure you use a soap that will not irritate your skin. Dry your skin once you have cleaned it.

steps.title: Cut the plaster to fit the affected area.
steps.content: Cut the plaster to fit the affected area. It will contain the proper dosage of salicylic acid. Make sure it covers the entire wart, corn, or callus that you are trying to remove. If your wort, corn, or callus is stubborn, soak the affected area for 5 minutes before you apply the plaster. Make sure your skin dries completely before you place the plaster.

steps.title: Place the pad on your skin over the wart, corn, or callus.
steps.content: Place the pad on your skin over the wart, corn, or callus. Let it adhere fully, then cover it with a bandaid or a clean bandage.

steps.title: Repeat your treatment as needed.
steps.content: Repeat your treatment as needed. For corns and calluses, apply your salicylic acid every 48 hours for up to 14 days. For warts, apply it every 48 hours as needed. [4] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Rub the shampoo into your hair until it lathers.
steps.content: Rub the shampoo into your hair until it lathers. The lather indicates that you have used enough of the product for it to be effective. [5] X Research source Rubbing gets the shampoo down next to your scalp, where it can help your skin issue. Use your shampoo once or twice a week. If it hurts to rub your head, you may be using it too often.

steps.title: Allow the product to sit in your hair for 2-5 minutes.
steps.content: Allow the product to sit in your hair for 2-5 minutes. This gives it time to act on your skin so you can reap maximum benefits from the salicylic acid. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Wash it out thoroughly when the time is up.
steps.content: Wash it out thoroughly when the time is up. Give your hair an extra rinse. You don’t want salicylic acid to sit on your scalp all day.

steps.title: Reapply it for full effectiveness.
steps.content: Reapply it for full effectiveness. Go through the whole process again. Wash your hair, let it sit, then rinse it out. This gives the salicylic acid more time to work on your skin.

steps.title: Wash your face gently before using the salicylic acid cleanser.
steps.content: Wash your face gently before using the salicylic acid cleanser. This removes all of the excess oils from your face so the acid can have maximum effectiveness. Choose a gentle soap that won’t irritate your skin.

steps.title: Rub a small amount of the salicylic acid cleanser into your skin.
steps.content: Rub a small amount of the salicylic acid cleanser into your skin. Use a cleanser with 3% salicylic acid or less. [7] X Research source Rub for at least 10-20 seconds, so the acid has time to penetrate your skin. Use gentle circular hand motions to rub it in. [8] X Research source Gentle rubbing allows the acid to contact your skin without risking irritation.

steps.title: Look for a lather.
steps.content: Look for a lather. If it hasn’t worked up a lather, add a little more and rub again. Make sure you get at least 10-20 seconds of contact between your skin and the acid.

steps.title: Rinse your skin completely.
steps.content: Rinse your skin completely. You don’t want salicylic acid to sit on your skin all day. When you’re sure it’s all off, pat your skin dry with a clean towel.
